intro: Hieracium opacatum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a rosette of soft, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically yellow or brown, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Hieracium opacatum is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in disturbed soils.
